headline.main: VOTE ON WAR ASKED BY AMERICA FIRST; General Wood in a Letter to President Challenges Him to Test Congress' Stand

lead_paragraph: CHICAGO, Oct. 22 -- General Robert E. Wood, acting national chairman of the America First Committee, appealed today to President Roosevelt to submit to a vote of Congress the question of war or peace.
abstract: Wood opposes neutrality changes; urges Roosevelt seek Cong war vote
snippet: CHICAGO, Oct. 22 -- General Robert E. Wood, acting national chairman of the America First Committee, appealed today to President Roosevelt to submit to a vote of Congress the question of war or peace....

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES
